comment: * Callbacks to a {@link Fragment}'s container. * * @deprecated Use the Support Library * {@link androidx.fragment.app.FragmentContainer}.

methods.name: public abstract T onFindViewById(@IdRes int id)
methods.comment:
* Return the view with the given resource ID. May return {@code null} if the
     * view is not a child of this container.

methods.name: public abstract boolean onHasView()
methods.comment: * Return {@code true} if the container holds any view.

methods.name: public Fragment instantiate(Context context, String className, Bundle arguments)
methods.comment:
* Creates an instance of the specified fragment, can be overridden to construct fragments
     * with dependencies, or change the fragment being constructed. By default just calls
     * {@link Fragment#instantiate(Context, String, Bundle)}.
     *
     * @hide

methodNames: public abstract T onFindViewById(@IdRes int id)
public Fragment instantiate(Context context, String className, Bundle arguments)
